newsitem.title: USA: White House says Greece visit report incorrect.
newsitem.headline: White House says Greece visit report incorrect.

text.p: The White House said on Sunday a newspaper report from Athens that President Bill Clinton would visit Greece and Turkey next year was incorrect.
"The story is incorrect. The White House has no plans and has made no announcements concerning any possible visits to Greece or Turkey," a White House spokesman said.
The daily Kathimerini, quoting White House sources, said Clinton planned to visit Athens and Ankara next June to promote closer relations between Greece and Turkey.

The two countries, despite being NATO allies, almost went to war in January over disputed, uninhabited islets in the Aegean Sea. The United States stepped in to broker a deal which eased the tension but Greek-Turkish relations remain on a tightrope.
"Mr Clinton wants to show his personal interest in the eastern Mediterranean and Greek-Turkish relations," the paper's Washington correspondent Alexis Papahelas said, quoting a White House official.
Greek government officials could not be reached to comment on the report but government spokesman Dimitris Reppas has said Athens awaits a new U.S. initiative.
Athens and Ankara are at odds over territorial rights in the Aegean Sea, dotted with thousands of islands, and over the divided island of Cyprus.
